body:
Yep, that were RHEL/CentOS kernel versions.

This was a side-effect of fixing CVE-2013-7446 (https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/7d267278a9ece963d77eefec61630223fce08c6c), upstream:

- [2.6.32.70](https://cdn.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v2.6/longterm/v2.6.32/ChangeLog-2.6.32.70)
- [3.2.75](https://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v3.x/ChangeLog-3.2.75)
- [3.4.111](https://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v3.x/ChangeLog-3.4.111)
- [3.10.95](https://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v3.0/ChangeLog-3.10.95)
- [3.12.52](https://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v3.0/ChangeLog-3.12.52)
- [3.18.26](https://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v3.0/ChangeLog-3.18.26)
- [4.1.15](https://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v4.x/ChangeLog-4.1.15)
- [4.2.8](https://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v4.x/ChangeLog-4.2.8)
- [4.3.3](https://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v4.x/ChangeLog-4.3.3)
- 4.4+
